children.text: Tag your writing by typing `#` and hashtag name, just like on Twitter.
If you click on the hashtag, it will start a search for all of the blocks with that tag and show in sidebar.
You can organize your writing hierarchically by nesting them within each other, just like a folder/file structure but more flexible.
To nest your notes,  you can click
in the note dropdown, either from the sidebar or from the note header.
Here are some basics to help you get started.
mdSilo is both a Markdown editor and a knowledge silo with windows.
mdSilo runs in web browser entirely and has the Local System File Access ability, function as same as a native app.
mdSilo lets you control the data and even the code.
mdSilo is in public beta and active development, we can make it better together.
Now, You can click the feather icon on sidebar to start writing.
We also want to talk something more about Linking which is the first-class citizen on mdSilo.
mdSilo has different types of link, which can connect everything in your writings.
You can link text to other notes, and each note displays the notes that link to it (its "BackLinks"). This  helps  build connections between related thoughts.
You can link to a block in other different note as reference.
Just like a web page, you can link to any other web page just by pasting the url link.
Your mdSilo is your digital garden, your second brain, it also like your island on internet.
Sometimes, we need a bridge to other islands. so PubLink can help link to a liaison point between digital gardens or brains. Just like we get together with strangers or friends in a Pub.
makes the most of your screen estate by opening writings side by side.
You get side by side writing, editing and view.
OK, This is first depth of page stacking,
Now try second depth of page stacking:
At the bottom the BackLinks show up.
This is the third stacking note.
Try to connect to other note, it will show in a
view when you click and on a big screen.
Just type double square brackets `[[` and some characters, there will be some notes searched out for you to choose, if no any, when you type end square brackets `]]`, a new note will be created.
Just try out here: start typing `[[` ....
Try to link to a block in other note,  like:
reference to a block in other note.
In the note which you want to be a reference and in the side menu, click `Copy the Block` and then paste it here.
Type double round brackets `((` and some text to trigger searching note or block you want to reference.
Link your note to a public liaison point, which can be a wiki page of a book, documentary, a concept or any systematic knowledge.

Just type double braces `{{` and texts to search public note to link.  you can also initiate a page to link for yourself and others.  when you type end braces `}}`, a public page with a title of your input text will be created.
Everyone can edit the public pages, the PubLinks that link your private notes to public pages will never be stored, so do not be afraid of leaking your privacy.
,  just paste the url or add link to text like in other editors.
, link the note to the text which is same to the title of the note.
Block reference to link between note and block, reference to a block in other note.
Notice: on the right side of the referenced block, The number and notes reference the block will be shown.
Direct Mention is text within Backlink;
Indirect Mention is text that is as same as the title of this note;
mdSilo is a mind silo for storing ideas, thought, knowledge with a powerful writing and networked-thinking app and markdown support.  It was born for a reason:

We need a place to store our thought and knowledge as digital garden or second brain, but it is better not a totally isolated island or walled digital garden. So mdSilo to open a window and build a bridge for each digital garden, we can connect each other via PubLink, just like link to liaison points between private digital gardens, a liaison point can be a shared wiki page of a book, documentary, a concept or any systematic knowledge generated from different digital gardens spontaneously.
in writing by BackLink, Block Reference, etc.
and nested notes to help organize writings.
: Graph view, Chronicle view, Task view...
with json | md support, your writing can be sit in a single json.
Side menu, hovering toolbar, hotkeys, slash command to make writing and formatting fun.
) for mobile and desktop,  just add it to your home screen or install, you will get a full-function app.
Local System File Access in some web browsers on desktop makes mdSilo to function as same as native desktop app.
... More to discover and on the way.
You can take and network your writing anywhere, anytime, entirely in your browser.
And mdSilo web app is also a PWA(Progressive Web App). This means that you can install mdSilo just as a native desktop or mobile app.
Click the icon next to the bookmark icon on the right side of the address bar, then click
Safari  and Firefox for desktop does not support PWAs.
banner on the bottom of your screen to install mdSilo.
Tap the 3 dots in the top right, then
Tap the 3 dots in the top right, then tap
A desktop app is coming soon.
mdSilo is equipped with a powerful writing tool.
Most markdown elements and shortcuts can be used in mdSilo and previewed in real time manner.
Just type `/` or `\` to trigger slash command, this helps make typing time|date and tagging task easier.
When your cursor focused, you can see a 3-vertical-dot menu at left end, this is side menu;
When you select any text, a toolbar with many icons will show up, which is hovering toolbar;
Both of them can help format your writing.
mdSilo has many keyboard shortcuts to help you do things faster. Just pay a bit attention to the tooltips to learn more.
If you cannot focus your cursor sometimes, especially at the end of your workspace, please try the option `Insert a Break` in Side Menu.
You can import standard Markdown files into mdSilo. If any imported files have the same name as an existing note, then the existing note will be overridden, so be careful.
You can also import json file, but it must be the file exported from mdSilo for some special structure required.
You can export your writings in 3 ways:
Export all your works in a single json file, click `md: x` in sidebar, a dropdown menu will show up;
Export a note as a standard Markdown file, click `Export` in dropdown from note header;
Export a zip file with all Markdown files and a json file, click `Export All` in dropdown from note header;
In exporting as Markdown file, some formats in your writing may be discarded, such as, BackLinks, Block Reference, PubLink.
Yes, mdSilo is 100% free for anyone without limitation. And it is open, you can even deploy by yourself.
Even though mdSilo is free, we'd really appreciate it if you can support our development.  We will provide some add-on services in the future.
Yes!  mdSilo has first-class offline mode, you can write anywhere, anytime, entirely in your web browser even offline, no register required, no install required.  But:
You need to load the web app firstly, it is internet connection needed;
Better export your works as Markdown files or single json file when you leave or close the web app.
If you are offline totally(no internet connection), the PubLink feature is limited.
We are working on a desktop App,
writing on mdSilo will be even a better experience.
Is there a desktop or mobile app?
mdSilo is a Progressive Web App (PWA).  you can

on desktop or mobile, it will function as same as a native app. especially if your web browser on desktop supports local file system access, you can write on top of a local folder just like a desktop app.
And Yes, A desktop App is coming soon.  The mobile app is still in long-term plans.

We need a place to store our thought and knowledge as digital garden or second brain, but it is better not a totally isolated island or walled digital garden. So mdSilo to open a window and build a bridge for each digital garden, we can connect each other via

, just like link to liaison points between private digital gardens, a liaison point can be a shared wiki page of a book, documentary, a concept or any systematic knowledge generated from different digital gardens spontaneously.
We can utilize the leverage of network effect in a better way.
mdSilo is designed to be easy-to-use, free-to-use and accessible to anyone. It is free and open.

mdSilo is equipped with a versatile and powerful networking-writing tool, WYSIWYG editor, markdown support, real time live preview, first-class linking and more.  It is available to anyone with a web browser, No install required. Just launch your web browser and go to

mdSilo is Privacy-first, no register required, can work offline.  You fully own and control your data, we cannot sell your data or advertise to you based on your data because we cannot even access your data.
mdSilo is open source, so anyone can inspect it and make it even better.
Plus, mdSilo has some unique features as well, like PubLink, Task view and more, you can connect, organize, view your writings from different perspective.
The best way to know why mdSilo is a good choice is to try it out for yourself. You can get started with mdSilo for free without limitation.
We appreciate any support from you: recommend it to your friends, report bugs, contribution in coding, and so on.
If you have more question, feedback, suggestion, feature request, or need help, please go to our
, we are waiting there for you.
Stack your minds in a bigger picture.
You fully own and control your data. mdSilo runs entirely in your web browser and store your data on your computer.

If your web browser supports local file system access, writing on top of a local folder is recommended. Some web browsers that support the File System Access API (Edge and Chrome) allow web pages to access the local file system with your permission.
You can set up any cloud sync service you trust for your data on the said local folder.

If your web browser doesn't support local file system access, like Firefox, Safari or on mobile, you can export and import your data as a single json file and store it in a local folder or cloud or IPFS.
Just start writing, export(save) works as a json file, then import(open) the json file and continue writing.
You can always import and export Markdown files on mdSilo. Markdown is widely used and can be edited by text editors or Markdown editors.
It is useful when you want to move your data or publish your work to other services.
In exporting as Markdown file, some formats in your writing may be discarded, such as, BackLinks, Block Reference, PubLink.
